faq.question: How stable is the 3.0 RC1 release?
faq.answer: We have been using and testing the 3.0 release for a few months and fixed a couple of bugs during this period. We have not seen major bugs in the system core for a while now and we consider it stable. If you find any issues, please let us know.

faq.question: When will the 3.0 version be officially released?
faq.answer: We are aiming to officially release the 3.0 version by the end of November 2008.

faq.question: I am planning to start using , should I choose 2.x or the 3.0 RC1 version?
faq.answer: By all means, start with the 3.0 RC1 version. It offers much simpler Java API, better accompanying applications and documentation. The only reason you might want to stick with the 2.x line is when your software must run under JDK 1.4, which v3.0 does not support.

faq.question: Should I migrate my 2.x-based software to the 3.0 version?
faq.answer: If you'd like to take advantage of the improved clustering quality in version 3.0 and new features planned for further 3.x releases, you should migrate.

faq.question: How do I migrate my 2.x-based software to the 3.0 version?
faq.answer: If you are using Java API, download the 3.0 release Java API package and replace the calls to API in your software where appropriate. If you are using the Document Clustering Server (DCS), download the 3.0 release DCS run your software against it. The changes in the DCS API were very minor, mainly to introduce consistent parameter naming.

faq.question: What will be the status of the 2.x version when 3.0 is officially released?
faq.answer: After the official release of v3.0, the 2.x line will enter the maintenance mode with all new features being added to the 3.x line and the 2.x line being limited to bug fixes only.
